New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers matched the second-best start to a season in NBA history with a 15-0 record.
The Cavaliers became only the fourth team in NBA history to open 15-0, matching the 1948-49 Washington Capitols and 1993-94 Houston Rockets.
The win streak is the longest in the Cavaliers' 55-year history, surpassing three 13-win runs when LeBron James was with Cleveland.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland had 25 points and 12 assists.
Evan Mobley scored 23 points and grabbed 11 rebounds.
Jarrett Allen contributed 21 points and 15 rebounds.
Charlotte's LaMelo Ball had 31 points and 12 assists in a losing effort.
Post-Match Reflections: Darius Garland emphasized the team's collective effort and readiness to play despite Donovan Mitchell's absence.

Garland stated, 'We've always got some fight in us no matter what. Everybody is ready to play. It doesn't matter, one through 15. Everybody contributed. Everybody had a huge part in this win. That's just us. Just as a team effort.'
